cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi (50 km) NW of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest through the Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and running very near or just off the southeast Florida coast before lifting up the U.S. East Coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Florida’s southeast coast (between West Palm Beach and Cape Canaveral)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along Florida (Hurricane Warnings confined to the Bahamas)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coast from the Upper Keys through Cape Canaveral and the entire Bahamas chain
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 kt, gusts 50+ kt) possible Saturday evening through early Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge above ground level possible in onshore flow along the Broward County coast, especially around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated pockets up to 6 inches; risk of localized flash flooding and ponding on terminal surfaces.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and rough seas that may force temporary channel/berth closures and restrict cargo operations.
